channel.title: 667 - Timer on attacking NPCs/Eating food
channel.description:
There is some weird timer while attacking NPCs or eating food out of the inventory. It seems that you can only eat food every 1 minute 20 seconds, along with attacking NPCs, there is a timer for it. It doesn't say anything, it just doesn't let you eat and doesn't let you attack a new NPC after killing the other one.
I've googled this, searched all the files for 80 (1m20s), 80000 (80s in milliseconds), and I couldn't find any results that looked like they may be the problem. I'm not sure what file it would be in, so let me know if you need to see any of my files to fix the problem, I'm decent with JAVA but not good enough to find/fix problems like this.
Any help is appreciated, to make people more obligated to help, I can offer a reward/compensation, I can't give money because it isn't allowed on Mopar, but I can exchange for Website/Forums design (I have degrees in HTML, CSS, PHP, and MySQL), or GFX (I have an 'eye for design', and I do art work on the side). Thanks everyone/anyone that has read this! Comment or Private message me if you are up to giving a fix or some solutions to fixing the problem. - The Web Guy / AJ

item.title: 667 - Timer on attacking NPCs/Eating food
item.dc:creator: @Skill_3D Skill 3D
item.description:
@Skill_3D wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:2, topic:448973”]I don’t wish to receive an award, as that is not allowed here. Even if it was, I wouldn’t like one.

Anyway, you might find something similar to

if (System.currentTimeMillis() - aLong >= aTimeInMilliseconds) { return; } else { // Eat food, attack npc, etc. }

Which would be where you would find this. I’ve never looked at a #667 so I couldn’t tell you where to look.

But you would change the ‘aTimeInMilliseconds’ to the desired time (delay) between actions.[/quote]

Found it before reading your post, but yes, it was somewhat similar to that.

Read full topic

item.title: 667 - Timer on attacking NPCs/Eating food
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

I don’t wish to receive an award, as that is not allowed here. Even if it was, I wouldn’t like one.

Anyway, you might find something similar to

if (System.currentTimeMillis() - aLong >= aTimeInMilliseconds) { return; } else { // Eat food, attack npc, etc. }

Which would be where you would find this. I’ve never looked at a #667 so I couldn’t tell you where to look.

But you would change the ‘aTimeInMilliseconds’ to the desired time (delay) between actions.

Read full topic
